imdb.title: Kurosu gêmu
imdb.plot: 5th grader Koh Kitamura lives next door to the Tsukishima family, owners of a batting cage and the Clover cafe. His girlfriend, Wakaba, is the 2nd Tsukishima daughter; the 3rd daughter, the baseball prodigy Aoba, can't stand him. ...

episodes.title: Four-Leaf Clover
episodes.plot: Kou has always been close to Wakaba, the second of the four Tsukishima sisters. But a few days after Wakaba goes camping, Kou hears some jarring news.

episodes.title: I Hate You!
episodes.plot: Kou, now a third year in junior high, recalls a childhood sandlot game against Wakaba's younger sister Aoba, who is now an active baseball player.

episodes.title: For Real?
episodes.plot: Fall. Kou decides to play sandlot ball with his old grade school friends. But after some pitching practice, Nakanishi tells him to play right field.

episodes.title: Secret Weapon
episodes.plot: Nakanishi and Akaishi realize Kou's talent and discuss getting him to play baseball. A surly guy visits the batting center and fires off home runs.

episodes.title: Can I Borrow a Pot?
episodes.plot: Kou, Akaishi and Nakanishi practice on the high school field on New Year's Eve. Kou and Aoba ring in the new year while nursing a sick Momiji.

episodes.title: Who Are You?
episodes.plot: The new coach, Daimon, divides the club into two teams: those who passed an exam, and the "Prefab" B-team. Kou and the others join the latter.

episodes.title: Sucker for a Pretty Face
episodes.plot: Daimon makes Aoba pitch for the varsity team's practice, where she gradually starts striking players out. Then transfer student Azuma steps up to bat.

episodes.title: You Two Are Alike
episodes.plot: The starting lineup for the game against the varsity team is fixed and Kou starts feeling the pressure. Aoba tells him his pitches are "all right."

episodes.title: Let's Do This!
episodes.plot: The game against the varsity team begins. Based on advice from Aoba, Kou considers varying his pitches to contend with the varsity batters.

episodes.title: Yeah, Right
episodes.plot: Drained, Kou ditches his waning control for speed. The team is in a pinch, but Azuma's varsity team begins to recognize their opponents' strength.

episodes.title: Wipe That Smirk Off Your Face
episodes.plot: Varsity ace Kamikawa puts pressure on the Prefab team, but a hit from Kou ties the game. At the bottom of the ninth, Kou faces Azuma a fourth time.

episodes.title: I Challenge You!
episodes.plot: Kou and Senda watch Seishu Junior High win a practice game thanks to Aoba's pitching. Senda's cousin Midori hears about it and shows interest in Aoba.

episodes.title: Summer Training Camp?
episodes.plot: The summer regional qualifiers for Koshien begin. Concerned about Kou, Azuma drops by the Prefab club room between games, only to find it empty.

episodes.title: How Many Points?
episodes.plot: When Azuma's brother Junpei sees Aoba home from the qualifiers, he instantly falls for her sister Ichiyo and begins frequenting Café Clover.

episodes.title: Enjoy It More
episodes.plot: Coaches Maeno and Daimon bet their careers on a final game. Aoba joins the Prefab team for the contest, and Maeno gets unusually tough in practice.

episodes.title: How Should I Know?
episodes.plot: The Prefab and varsity teams face off without Azuma. Kou's pitches keep getting hit, leaving the team with no outs and the bases loaded.

episodes.title: That's Tough
episodes.plot: After the Prefab team's win, Daimon and the interim principal leave and the varsity team disbands. Azuma stays behind and freeloads off Kou.

episodes.title: An Audition?
episodes.plot: Risa, the club's manager, confesses her love to Senda, but it's just practice for an audition. Meanwhile, Midori arrives to challenge Aoba once again.

episodes.title: Memories...
episodes.plot: Kou, Aoba and their families visit Aoba's grandparents, the Asamis. After finding a tree that holds memories of Wakaba, Kou notices something odd.

episodes.title: Mizuki Asami
episodes.plot: Aoba's cousin Mizuki moves in and joins her at Seishu High. Despite being unable to play in official games, Aoba joins the same baseball club as Kou.

episodes.title: No Matter What Happens
episodes.plot: The baseball club picks up after Aoba joins and wins a practice game with her help. Mizuki goes to the movies with Aoba, but she seems distracted.

episodes.title: You Underestimated It, Didn't You?
episodes.plot: When Midori visits her, Aoba expects another challenge. But this time Midori asks her to come play with her baseball team in a practice game.

episodes.title: We'll Make a Comeback, Right?
episodes.plot: Aoba steps up as relief pitcher for Midori's high school team. She keeps the next batters in check and goes to bat hoping to even the score.

episodes.title: Don't You Quit
episodes.plot: While watching Ryuou Academy play, Azuma reunites with Miki and promises to meet him again on the field. The summer regional qualifiers begin.

episodes.title: It's an Honour
episodes.plot: Seishu plays Sannou High in the second round. Kou gets serious after Sannou exploits their weaknesses, but Sannou's coach has a secret plan.

episodes.title: I Know
episodes.plot: Sannou leads 1-0 going into the fifth inning. They try to wear Kou down by bunting, but their batters can't keep up with his smoking fastballs.

episodes.title: He May Be Right
episodes.plot: Seishu faces Ryuou Academy without Azuma's rival, Mishima. Seishu leads after Azuma's home run, but then cleanup hitter Shimano steps up to bat.

episodes.title: Let's End This
episodes.plot: Seishu keeps their lead against Ryuou, but Mishima ties the score after replacing an injured Shimano. Kou faces Mishima in the bottom of the ninth.

episodes.title: No I'm Not!
episodes.plot: The game goes into extra innings, where relief pitcher Oikawa shuts out Seishu. In the bottom of the tenth, Aoba notices something wrong with Kou.

episodes.title: Wakaba
episodes.plot: On the way home from practice, Kou and Azuma meet a girl who looks exactly like Wakaba would had she still been alive, reminding Kou of days gone by.

episodes.title: Do Ghosts Grow Older?
episodes.plot: Kou visits Wakaba's grave the day of the summer festival and meets Wakaba's lookalike on his way home. They decide to attend the festival together.

episodes.title: Hey
episodes.plot: Wakaba's lookalike, Akane, moves in next door to Kou. Aoba dislikes the new proximity between them, and treats Akane harshly as a result.

episodes.title: Or Is It Fate...?
episodes.plot: The fall tournament begins, and Seishu Academy wins their first game. Meanwhile, Akane goes with Kou to thank Aoba for saving her from a thug.

episodes.title: Happy New Year
episodes.plot: Junpei and Ichiyo are pick pocketed while visiting a shrine on New Year's Day. Kou chases down the thief, but is saved by someone unexpected.

episodes.title: 14 February
episodes.plot: Akane's poster modeled on Aoba wins first prize in a competition, but her subject isn't impressed. Aoba weighs up Koshien and women's baseball.

episodes.title: To Women's Baseball?!
episodes.plot: Aoba's pitches catch eyes at the women's baseball selection test. But before the results are called, Shimano's cousin Megumi makes a proposition.

episodes.title: I Guess I Slept Well
episodes.plot: Aoba is injured during practice and withdraws from the selection test. Meanwhile, Junpei takes Ichiyo to the beach to ask her something important.

episodes.title: It's His First Date
episodes.plot: Azuma runs into Daimon, now a coach at Kurokoma Vocational School, and criticizes him for still being overbearing. Kou and Akane go see a kabuki play.

episodes.title: Since Forever
episodes.plot: Kou, now in his third year of high school, learns breaking balls from Aoba. Akane applies to work part time at Café Clover and is hired the same day.

episodes.title: Idiot!
episodes.plot: The coach of the national women's team invites Aoba to their training camp, while Junpei helps out Seishu in order to fulfill Ichiyo's marriage terms.

episodes.title: Koshien, Here I Go!
episodes.plot: Junpei becomes the baseball club's hitting coach. Kou visits Wakaba's grave on her birthday and meets her father Seiji, who has something to say.

episodes.title: Everyone's Summer
episodes.plot: Before the summer tournament, Kou and Akaishi visit the place where they used to practice. Ozaki from Ouka Women's College comes to challenge Aoba.

episodes.title: She Hasn't Changed
episodes.plot: Seishu wins their first game of the summer tournament in a called game. Kurokoma, led by coach Daimon, faces Sena Municipal and its captain, Miki.

episodes.title: A Careless Pitch?
episodes.plot: Ryuou's Mishima and Oikawa watch the pitchers' duel between Kou and Miki from the stands as both Sena and Seishu enter the final stage scoreless.

episodes.title: That's My Line!
episodes.plot: Seishu advances through to the quarterfinals. When Aoba worries about Akane, who misses both the game and work, Akaishi gives her some shocking news.

episodes.title: I've Got a Bad Feeling
episodes.plot: Aoba and Akaishi visit Akane and report their win in the quarterfinals. When Aoba mentions Kou not visiting, Akane tells them about a promise he made.

episodes.title: Can I Lie?
episodes.plot: Kou visits Akane and learns that her surgery is the day of the final. Kou invites Aoba to visit Wakaba's grave and tells her about Akane's surgery.

episodes.title: All Right
episodes.plot: During the final between Seishu and Ryuou, Aoba goes to the hospital for Akane's surgery. Going into the seventh inning, both teams remain scoreless.

episodes.title: Are You Having Fun?
episodes.plot: While Kou faces Mishima head on, Aoba tells Junpei about a promise Kou made. Seishu keeps their one point lead as the game enters its final inning.

episodes.title: More Than Anyone in the World...
episodes.plot: Seishu leads in the twelfth inning thanks to Kou. With Mishima at bat with a full count, Kou throws the game-deciding pitch with everything he's got.
